@DuvalSimmonds I agree with this list. But we are a stat driven society. Metrics rule the sport. I see ppl saying nobody cares how many pts u got in a loss. BUT check your TL and you will see tweets from media services about pts scored in a loss.

@DuvalSimmonds Social media has alot to do with that. No one wants to highlight a stat line of 5 pts, 4 asst, 3 stls, 2 charges, 0 turnovers in 30 mins of play. It's not appealing on social media. But that stat line from a PG will win you alot of games.

@primediscussion @chriso140 You are 100 percent right. We are discussing two separate things. I just find it interesting that todays youth (12-16 yr olds) all like the same music 25-30 yr olds like. And that is not the way it was in the 90s. For R&B and Hip hop.

@primediscussion @chriso140 On the radio today you will not find a group that 13 yr olds like that they can relate to. The industry has done away with that. You ask any kid what they listen to and its the same thing adults listen to.
Lil Kim was not marketed to children as they do Nicki and Cardi

@primediscussion @chriso140 The industry has got rid of choices. Everything is similar
In the 90's you hadfor kids (ABC), for pro black music (Brand Nubian, KRS), adult themed female (Lil Kim), conscious female (Queen Latifia), Underground (Das EFX), Baller (Jay Z, Biggie).... The list goes on.
@primediscussion You beat me to the punch on this one. I read it and was like, "I agree" then I thought about it. Mos definitely the wrong guy to make the right argument.
